lead_paragraph: Luke Salas traveled to Cuba in 2012 with a dream of using baseball as a cultural exchange between two longtime foes. With a recent thaw in relations, Salas, a Cuban-American, now envisions the sport’s renaissance in the land of his ancestors.

headline.print_headline: Building a Bridge of Bats and Balls Across a Divide
headline.main: Building a Bridge of Bats and Balls Across a Divide

snippet: Luke Salas traveled to Cuba in 2012 with a dream of using baseball as a cultural exchange between two longtime foes. With a recent thaw in relations, Salas, a Cuban-American, now envisions the sport’s renaissance in the land of his ancestors.
abstract: Luke Salas, former minor-league baseball player of Cuban descent who tried in 2012 to become first American to play in Cuban leagues since revolution, remains active in efforts to normalize baseball relations between countries.
